intro: Moghamia, commonly known as the desert spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. Moghamia is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various desert animals.
